title: Economy Map Synthesis v3-8: 'Close the Loop'
subtitle: What the US Economy Becomes — 2026-2031 Projection Based on 413 Models, 15 Sector Transformations, 6 Macro Forces, 8 Geographic Profiles

executive_summary.headline: The US economy is restructuring around a healthcare employment monoculture, AI-driven wage compression in knowledge work, and physical-sector bifurcation between automated and human-premium services. This is not a recession — it is a structural transformation where headline employment metrics mask radical compositional shifts underneath.
key_findings: Healthcare absorbs 63% of job creation while facing an 8% nursing deficit — simultaneously the only growth sector AND unable to meet its own demand

Inverse Baumol (P-040) confirmed as cross-sector: AI compresses knowledge-work wage premiums by replacing expensive judgment roles with cheaper AI-augmented operations. Securities confirmed, Accounting converging, Legal and Insurance on predicted timelines

Retail Trade (15.5M workers) enters early disruption with 3 models scoring above 81.0 — retail media networks, warehouse robotics, and autonomous checkout represent the new #1, #2, and #10 overall. AI meets the average American worker

Counter-signals provide first discipline check: FS cascade may be 4-6 year slow burn not 2-3 year acute stress (banks passed $550B stress test, office absorption positive). IT Services 26.8% decline may confuse compositional shift with absolute decline

Total inventory: 413 rated models across 15 sector transformations. New #1: Retail Media Network Platform (86.5 composite) — a business model that didn't exist 5 years ago now outscores every defense, governance, and infrastructure model
executive_summary.what_changed_since_v37: v3-8 delivers on v3-7's identified gaps: first counter-signals ever produced (9 across 3 sectors), first retail coverage (15.5M workers), healthcare deep dive with QCEW sub-sector data, P-040 Inverse Baumol cross-sector test, and this Master Synthesis — the capstone output the framework was built to produce but had never generated.

layer_1_force_velocity_report.description: All 6 macro forces with direction, velocity, confidence, and key evidence from v3-8 cycle

F1_technology.v38_headline: Benchmark fragmentation era — no single model dominates all capability axes
key_evidence: Opus 4.6 leads GDPval-AA (enterprise knowledge work) by 144 Elo over GPT-5.2
GPT-5.3-Codex first model classified 'high' cybersecurity risk — new precedent where capability triggers internal safety gates
Gemini 3 Flash outperforms Gemini 3 Pro on SWE-bench (78%) — capability decoupled from model size
SB 53 enforcement challenge is first state-level AI safety law test
Retail: self-checkout 87% consumer adoption, cashierless 13.7% CAGR, warehouse automation $181B by 2031
Healthcare: 71% hospitals deployed predictive AI, 2.2x faster adoption than broader economy
F1_technology.projection_2026_2031: Technology force continues accelerating through 2026-2027 but enters Gartner Trough of Disillusionment phase for enterprise GenAI. Hype rationalizes into sustainable deployment. Capability frontier fragments across specialized axes (reasoning, coding, enterprise, multimodal). Physical AI (robotics, autonomous systems) becomes the next acceleration wave 2027-2029. Inference cost continues 50x/yr decline, enabling new application tiers annually.
F1_technology.falsification: If inference costs plateau above $0.10/M tokens for 12+ months, or if no frontier model achieves >90% on SWE-bench by 2028, technology force decelerates.

F2_demographics.v38_headline: BLS reveals 2025 was dramatically weaker than reported — 15K/month job creation is recessionary
key_evidence: 2025 revised from 584K to 181K total jobs (only 15K/month average)
Four months of 2025 now show NET job losses (Jan, Jun, Aug, Oct)
862K downward revision — second-largest on record after 2009
Healthcare 63% of Jan 2026 jobs, confirming monoculture (P-039)
Federal workforce -212K (-9%) from DOGE, now visible in BLS data
Nursing 8% national deficit, 250K RN gap by 2030
College cliff executing: CCA (119 years), Martin University (HBCU), accelerating rate
F2_demographics.projection_2026_2031: Demographic forces intensify through 2026-2028 as Silver Tsunami peaks (52.3% of businesses owned by 55+), entry-level extinction deepens, and college cliff accelerates closures. Healthcare monoculture persists through 2028 at minimum — counter-signals suggest it may be structurally sustainable (aging demographics), not fragile. DOGE cuts create DC/VA/MD regional restructuring. Retail displacement (15.5M workers) becomes politically visible by 2027.
F2_demographics.falsification: If non-healthcare sectors sustain positive job creation for 3+ consecutive months, monoculture thesis weakens. If 2026 college enrollment stabilizes, cliff is shallower than projected.

F3_geopolitics.v38_headline: Immigration enforcement escalation + DOGE federal cuts create new domestic geopolitical forces
key_evidence: Operation PARRIS extends enforcement to legally admitted refugees — qualitative escalation
India AI Impact Summit (Feb 16-20) approaching with $100B+ expected commitments
SB 53 enforcement test — first state AI safety law challenge (California vs OpenAI)
DOGE -212K federal workers = unprecedented modern downsizing
US-China tariff truce through Nov 2026 holding but Iran linkage threatens
F3_geopolitics.projection_2026_2031: Domestic geopolitical forces (immigration enforcement, federal downsizing, state-federal AI regulation conflict) become as significant as international ones. India emerges as third AI compute node by 2028. US-China bifurcation continues but China's self-sustaining ecosystem (5 frontier labs) limits export control leverage. ReArm Europe EUR 800B reshapes European defense-industrial base through 2030.
F3_geopolitics.falsification: If DOGE cuts are reversed (worker recalls already happening), federal workforce impact is temporary. If India AI commitments don't materialize post-summit, third node thesis weakens.

F4_capital.v38_headline: Counter-signals challenge FS cascade timeline — banks resilient, office market stabilizing
key_evidence: Banks passed 2025 stress tests absorbing $550B hypothetical losses, $52B CRE specifically
Office net absorption positive for first time since 2019 (12.5M SF in 2025)
Vacancy declining to 16.3%, forecast 15.9% by YE 2026
BUT: CMBS delinquency still at all-time record, $936B maturity wall in 2026
Healthcare PE record $190B+ deal value in 2025
Retail: 800+ store closures announced 2026
PE refinancing wall $930B maturing in 2026, distress rate 11.98% (+148%)
F4_capital.projection_2026_2031: Capital forces bifurcate: AI mega-capital continues accelerating ($140B+ frontier raises) while traditional commercial real estate enters extended workout. Counter-signals suggest FS cascade is 4-6 year slow burn not 2-3 year acute event. PE refinancing wall ($1.5-1.8T through 2028) creates rolling distress opportunities. Healthcare PE ($190B+) and defense tech (exits > investment) are Deployment-phase capital flows. Retail capital bifurcates: e-commerce/fulfillment attracts investment while physical retail enters managed decline.
F4_capital.falsification: If CMBS delinquency peaks and begins declining in Q2-Q3 2026, cascade thesis weakens significantly. If PE refinancing wall resolves without widespread distress, capital shift is orderly not disruptive.

F5_psychology.v38_headline: Gartner declares GenAI in Trough of Disillusionment — hype→reality transition
key_evidence: Gartner Trough of Disillusionment for GenAI (Feb 2026) — official peak hype behind us
Retail worker displacement: politically most sensitive (young, female, minority workers)
Healthcare AI: 34-pt provider-patient trust gap but adoption accelerating via invisible pathway
Counter-signal: METR 19% slower study has critical methodology limits (16 devs, 56% novice)
Counter-signal: IT Services 1.1M postings, 61% leaders plan increases — may be transformation not decline
F5_psychology.projection_2026_2031: Psychology force enters new phase: hype rationalizes (Gartner trough) but displacement fear intensifies as AI reaches blue-collar workers through retail automation. Dual-track: enterprise adoption becomes pragmatic and sustainable while worker/political fear peaks 2027-2028 when retail displacement becomes visible at scale. Education fear crystallizes into legislation (chatbot liability, AI framework mandates). Healthcare trust gap persists but invisible pathway continues circumventing it.
F5_psychology.falsification: If consumer AI sentiment improves above 50% favorable by 2027, fear friction thesis weakens. If retail automation backlash produces federal legislation before 2028, political response is faster than projected.

F6_energy.v38_headline: Meta 6.6 GW nuclear commitment — largest single-company nuclear deal in US history
key_evidence: Meta commits to 6.6 GW nuclear for data centers
BHP expects 'decades-long' copper structural deficit, LME inventories at 14-year lows
Water stress: 1.7B gallons/day globally for data center cooling
Grid queue remains binding constraint: 2,600 GW, 5+ year wait
Nuclear renaissance: TMI restart, Kairos SMR, 10GW+ committed for AI
F6_energy.projection_2026_2031: Energy becomes THE binding constraint on AI scaling velocity. Grid queue (5+ year wait) means capacity decisions made in 2026 determine 2031 AI infrastructure. Nuclear renaissance accelerates as hyperscalers commit to dedicated power generation. Copper deficit creates bottleneck by 2028. Water-energy tradeoff (Microsoft zero-water pilot) becomes standard by 2029. Solar employment continues explosive growth (+51.6%) despite policy headwinds.
F6_energy.falsification: If grid interconnection queue drops below 3 years or modular nuclear achieves commercial deployment before 2028, energy constraint loosens faster than projected.

layer_2_sector_transformation_matrix.description: 15 tracked sector transformations with phase, employment projection, top models, and confidence

sectors.phase: acceleration (under review — counter-signals suggest possible slow_burn reclassification)
sectors.key_dynamics: CMBS at all-time record but banks well-capitalized. Office fundamentals stabilizing. Counter-signals suggest 4-6 year workout not acute cascade. Inverse Baumol confirmed in Securities. Goldman +56%, JPM +35% AI profits — augmentation may outweigh displacement.
sectors.counter_signal_adjustment: Timeline extended from 2-3 to 4-6 years. Consider downgrade from 'acceleration' to 'slow_burn' if Q3 2026 bank earnings show CRE losses well below stress test scenarios.

sectors.employment_projection_2031: 7.5-8.5M (10-21% decline, range widened by counter-signals for IT Services sub-sector)
sectors.key_dynamics: IT Services (5415) counter-signals strong: 1.1M postings, 61% plan increases, AIOps $66.8B by 2032. METR 19% slower finding has methodology limits. Legal at highest fear friction (82%). Accounting converging toward Inverse Baumol.
sectors.counter_signal_adjustment: IT Services projection may need split: traditional IT declining, AI-native IT surging. Aggregate decline (26.8%) may become barbell (traditional -40%, AI-native +100%).

sectors.key_dynamics: Reshoring capital flowing but 2-5 year investment-to-production lag. China 90% humanoid robot market. CHIPS Act fabs creating semiconductor demand. ReArm Europe defense manufacturing. +5K jobs in Jan 2026 = first positive month in a year.

sectors.employment_projection_2031: 23-25M (growth continues but composition transforms: admin→AI, clinical→human premium)
sectors.key_dynamics: v3-8 DEEP DIVE: 63% of job creation, 8% nursing deficit, 250K RN gap by 2030. Counter-signals: aging demographics create non-discretionary demand (95% seniors have 1+ chronic condition), monoculture may be sustainable not fragile. AI enters via invisible pathway (admin→clinical). PE record $190B+. 34-pt trust gap persists. 12 new model cards.
sectors.counter_signal_adjustment: Reframe from 'fragile monoculture' to 'structurally sustainable monoculture with internal AI transformation.' Healthcare share of employment GROWS through 2028 before any AI-driven moderation.

sectors.key_dynamics: Staffing canary continues. Entry-level collapse deepens. UPS -30K. AI agents replacing temp/staffing matchmaking function.

sectors.employment_projection_2031: 7.5-8.5M (relatively stable, labor shortage constrains more than AI disrupts)
sectors.key_dynamics: +33K Jan 2026. Data center construction boom. 70 GW solar rush. Trades shortage (499K needed). Physical work resistant to AI but AI project estimation growing.
Zero-density Schumpeterian gap persists. When disruption arrives, it will be sudden not gradual.
First AI sector in Deployment phase. $2,750B global defense. ReArm Europe EUR 800B. CMMC enforcement (220K DIB companies). Counter-UAS $7.5B.

sectors.employment_projection_2031: 3.0-3.5M (10-23% decline, concentrated in higher ed administration)
sectors.key_dynamics: Highest fear friction (gap=5). College cliff executing (CCA 119yr, accelerating closure rate). Brookings 50-country study. Ohio/Michigan legislation. Fear creates $5-10B governance market.

sectors.phase: early_disruption (under review — counter-signals suggest possible transformation reclassification)
sectors.employment_projection_2031: 1.8-2.3M (6-27% decline, range dramatically widened by counter-signals)
sectors.key_dynamics: Counter-signals challenge aggregate decline: 1.1M postings, 61% leaders plan increases, AIOps $66.8B by 2032. METR methodology limits. India IT giants adapting (TCS 620 AI engagements). Self-disruption paradox: sector building AI is most disrupted by it.
sectors.counter_signal_adjustment: Split into traditional IT (declining 30-40%) and AI-native IT (growing 80-120%). Net effect may be flat to modest decline, not 27% collapse.

sectors.key_dynamics: Command-and-control layer. 55% routine-cognitive. Gartner: 20% eliminate >50% middle management by 2026. Coasean coordination cost collapse.
Primary cascade receptor. $936B maturity wall. Office values 35-50% below 2020. NAR settlement + AI agents = existential for 453K brokers. BUT counter-signals: positive absorption, vacancy declining.

sectors.employment_projection_2031: 0.85-0.95M (11-21% decline, but composition transforms more than headcount)
sectors.key_dynamics: Inverse Baumol reference sector. Wages -2.4%, employment +4.1%. Front-office → back-office composition shift. RIA M&A record. 38% advisors retiring within decade. Counter-signal: banks posting record AI profits — augmentation may dominate displacement.

sectors.employment_projection_2031: 12.5-14.0M (10-19% decline, concentrated in cashier, stocker, entry-level roles)
sectors.key_dynamics: v3-8 DEEP DIVE (first ever): Largest private employer, lowest Baumol (0.57) but massive absolute scale. Bifurcating: e-commerce vs physical vs AI-augmented omnichannel. Retail media $69B new profit layer. 3 STRUCTURAL_WINNERs in top 11 overall. Displacement concentrates on politically sensitive demographics. 800+ store closures 2026.

sectors.employment_projection_2031: 2.5-3.0M (3-19% decline, bifurcating: AI infra grows, content creation contracts)
sectors.key_dynamics: Internally bifurcating. AI infrastructure growing while content creation contracts. Deepfake/synthetic content (90% by 2026 per Europol) disrupts trust models.

aggregate_employment_projection.note: Employment declines are NOT evenly distributed. Healthcare GROWS while most others decline. The net aggregate decline masks radical compositional shifts. New categories (AI operations, synthetic content verification, autonomous systems maintenance) partially offset traditional role losses but require different skills.
aggregate_employment_projection.biggest_absolute_displacement: Retail Trade (1.5-3.0M roles), Administrative Services (1.7-2.7M roles), Professional Services (1.0-2.0M roles)
aggregate_employment_projection.biggest_growth_sector: Healthcare (+1.7-3.7M roles through 2031, driven by demographics)

layer_3_geographic_intelligence.description: 8 regional profiles with transformation velocity, AI readiness, and key v3-8 updates

regions.v38_update: BLS final revision reveals 2025 dramatically weaker (15K/mo). DOGE -212K federal workers creating DC/VA/MD restructuring. Operation PARRIS escalates immigration enforcement to legal refugees. SB 53 first state AI safety enforcement test. Retail (15.5M) enters early disruption.
regions.key_risk: Healthcare monoculture creates single-sector dependency. If Medicare/Medicaid policy changes, employment impact is outsized. Retail displacement is politically most sensitive.

regions.v38_update: No major new signals this cycle. Births sub-670K continues. Robotics-first transformation path remains distinct from US service-sector-first path.
5 frontier AI labs confirmed self-sustaining ecosystem. Birth collapse to 7.92M continues. 3 new AI chip fabs by late 2026. 90% humanoid robot market.
regions.key_divergence: China transforms manufacturing via robotics (physical AI) while US transforms services via LLMs (cognitive AI). Different force vectors, different timelines.

regions.v38_update: ReArm Europe EUR 800B is the defining event. AI Act high-risk delayed to Dec 2027 (Digital Omnibus). Defense-industrial transformation at Cold War scale.
slowest_sectors: Most sectors (AI Act friction despite delay)

regions.v38_update: AI Impact Summit Feb 16-20 approaching. Zero-tax-through-2047. $70-100B hyperscaler commitments. 9.2 GW data center target by 2030.
regions.key_event: AI Impact Summit outcomes (Feb 16-20) could add $100B+ in new commitments. India positioning as third global compute node.

regions.v38_update: Minimal new signals this cycle. Nearshoring continues. Young demographics provide buffer against AI displacement.
Minimal new signals. China+1 manufacturing migration continues. Variable AI readiness across ASEAN members.
$200B+ committed. HUMAIN 18K GB300s deployed. UAE Stargate 1GW. Positioning as neutral third compute hub between US-China.
regions.key_dynamic: Oil-to-AI conversion executing at unprecedented scale. Neutral compute hub positioning is strategic — serves both US and China ecosystems.

global_transformation_map.note: The same macro forces produce different transformation paths by region. US leads on cognitive/service disruption, China leads on physical/manufacturing, India leads on infrastructure build-out, EU leads on defense. No region is ahead on ALL dimensions.

layer_4_emergent_economy.description: New economic categories, firm structures, and labor roles emerging from the data that don't fit existing NAICS classifications

new_categories.name: Retail Media Networks
new_categories.description: Retailers monetizing customer data and store traffic through advertising platforms. $69B in 2026. Did not exist at scale 5 years ago. Now the #1 rated model in the entire inventory (86.5 composite).
new_categories.naics_gap: No NAICS code. Straddles 44-45 (Retail) and 541810 (Advertising). A new profit layer that subsidizes consumer-facing retail losses.
new_categories.employment_projection: 50-100K dedicated roles by 2028, plus data scientists and ad-tech engineers embedded in retail organizations.
new_categories.evidence: MC-V38-44-003 scored 86.5 = highest in 413-model inventory. Amazon, Walmart, Kroger, Target all operating media networks.

new_categories.name: AI Operations / MLOps / AIOps
new_categories.description: The operational layer for deploying, monitoring, and maintaining AI systems in production. AIOps market growing from $8.6B to $66.8B by 2032 (29.2% CAGR).
new_categories.naics_gap: Partially captured in 5415 (IT Services) but functionally distinct. New service category that didn't exist at scale 3 years ago.
new_categories.employment_projection: 500K-1M roles by 2031, partially offsetting traditional IT job losses.
new_categories.evidence: Counter-signal CS05: AI/ML/data science roles 49.2K postings (+163%), security 66.8K (+124%)

new_categories.name: Autonomous Commerce
new_categories.description: Cashierless stores, autonomous checkout, micro-fulfillment, drone delivery. Merging retail (44-45) with warehouse automation (49) and robotics (3344).
new_categories.naics_gap: Crosses NAICS 44-45, 48-49, and 3344. The autonomous commerce stack has no single NAICS home.
new_categories.employment_projection: 200-500K new roles by 2031 (robotics maintenance, system monitoring, exception handling) but displaces 1-3M traditional retail roles.
new_categories.evidence: MC-V38-44-001 (81.0), MC-V38-44-005 (84.0). Self-checkout 87% adoption, cashierless 13.7% CAGR, warehouse automation $181B by 2031.

new_categories.name: AI Safety and Governance Industry
new_categories.description: The fear economy — AI governance, compliance, safety testing, red teaming, audit. ~$86B TAM by 2030 ($15.8B governance + $9.8B safety + $60.6B cybersecurity).
new_categories.naics_gap: Partially 5416 (Management Consulting), partially 5182 (Data Processing). New category driven by fear (T25).
new_categories.employment_projection: 1-2M roles by 2031 across governance, compliance, audit, safety testing, red teaming.
new_categories.evidence: V3-FEAR-001 scored 83.0 = #3 overall. GPT-5.3 'high' cybersecurity risk classification. SB 53 enforcement. 280 state AI lawmakers.

new_categories.name: Synthetic Content Verification
new_categories.description: Authentication, watermarking, provenance tracking for content in the deepfake era. Europol projects 90% of online content synthetic by 2026.
new_categories.naics_gap: No existing NAICS. Emergent from deepfake trust collapse (Liar's Dividend).
new_categories.evidence: Europol 90% synthetic projection. 8M deepfakes 2025 (16x from 2023). Trust barriers creating demand.

new_firm_structures.name: AI-Augmented Solo Practice
new_firm_structures.description: Individual practitioners in accounting, legal, consulting operating at firm-scale output using AI tools. Coasean shrinkage (T10) manifesting as establishment growth exceeding employment growth.
new_firm_structures.evidence: Accounting: +5% establishment growth vs +3% employment growth. Tech-optimized firms at $250-350K revenue/employee vs $150-200K traditional. 532K business applications/month confirmed.

new_firm_structures.name: Healthcare AI Hybrid Organization
new_firm_structures.description: Healthcare organizations that are simultaneously care delivery AND technology companies. New roles: clinical data analysts, AI system trainers, digital health specialists.
new_firm_structures.evidence: 71% hospitals deployed predictive AI. Healthcare AI creating new roles faster than eliminating old ones. Healthcare PE $190B+ targeting AI-enabled platforms.

new_labor_roles: Autonomous systems exception handler (retail, warehouse, delivery)
AI compliance officer (SB 53, EU AI Act, state-level regulation)
Retail media data scientist (customer data monetization)

cross_layer_interactions.description: How force combinations produce sector outcomes — the causal map

key_interactions.interaction: AI capability + aging population = healthcare monoculture paradox
key_interactions.mechanism: AI automates routine cognitive work across most sectors (F1) while aging demographics create non-discretionary healthcare demand (F2). Net effect: healthcare absorbs workers displaced from other sectors, concentrating employment in one sector. AI enters healthcare via admin pathway, eventually reaching clinical, but demographic demand outpaces AI substitution through 2028-2029.

key_interactions.interaction: AI capability + capital concentration = Inverse Baumol mechanism
key_interactions.mechanism: AI automates expensive judgment tasks (F1) while capital seeks efficiency (F4). High-comp front-office roles are replaced by lower-comp AI-augmented operations. Net: employment stable or grows but average wages decline. This is the P-040 pattern — confirmed in Securities, converging in Accounting.

key_interactions.interaction: AI capability + worker fear = anticipatory displacement spiral
key_interactions.mechanism: 60% of firms cut headcount anticipating AI (F5) before AI actually delivers measurable EBIT (F1). Workers fear AI (60% expect net job losses) and either resist adoption or leave sectors preemptively. Entry-level extinction (67% junior dev decline) is partially demand-driven (firms not hiring) and partially supply-driven (young workers avoiding AI-disrupted fields). The spiral: firms anticipate → cut → workers fear → avoid → pipeline collapses → firms automate because pipeline is empty.
sectors_affected: All sectors, concentrated in IT Services, Professional Services, Administrative Services

key_interactions.interaction: Silver Tsunami + PE distress = business succession crisis
key_interactions.mechanism: 52.3% of businesses owned by 55+ (F2) while PE refinancing wall creates distress (F4). Businesses that can't find successors AND can't find PE buyers at reasonable multiples face closure. 58% have no succession plan, 70% never successfully sell. This concentrates in sectors where AI reduces the value proposition of the acquired business.
sectors_affected: All small business sectors, concentrated in services, retail, manufacturing

key_interactions.interaction: Defense rearmament + energy constraints = infrastructure competition
key_interactions.mechanism: ReArm Europe EUR 800B (F3) + defense tech $13.4B AI line + data center energy demand doubling (F6) creates competition for the same physical resources: energy, copper, rare earths, skilled labor, grid capacity. Defense and AI infrastructure compete for identical bottleneck resources.

key_interactions.interaction: Retail automation + entry-level workforce + political sensitivity = flashpoint
key_interactions.mechanism: AI automates retail entry-level roles (F1) that disproportionately employ young, female, minority workers (F2), creating the most politically sensitive displacement in the economy (F5). Unlike IT Services or Financial Services displacement (which affects higher-income, higher-education workers with more adaptive capacity), retail displacement hits the most economically vulnerable population.

confidence_and_falsification.description: What would change our projections, and what are we most and least certain about

highest_confidence_projections.projection: Healthcare employment grows through 2028 at minimum
highest_confidence_projections.reasoning: Aging demographics (26% seniors by 2035, 95% with chronic conditions), nursing 8% deficit, 250K RN gap by 2030. Even counter-signals agree this is structurally sustainable. AI enters via admin first, clinical impact after 2028.
highest_confidence_projections.falsification: Federal budget crisis that dramatically cuts Medicare/Medicaid reimbursement. Breakthrough in autonomous clinical care (very unlikely by 2028).

highest_confidence_projections.projection: Defense AI remains in Deployment phase (exits > investment)
highest_confidence_projections.reasoning: $2,750B global defense, ReArm Europe EUR 800B, CMMC enforcement, AUKUS. Bipartisan support. Fear of adversary AI adoption drives opposite psychology from civilian sectors.
highest_confidence_projections.falsification: Major peace deal reducing global defense spending by >20%. Wholesale defense budget cuts.

highest_confidence_projections.reasoning: Self-checkout 87% adoption, cashierless 13.7% CAGR, warehouse automation $181B, 800+ closures 2026. Near-zero current employment growth (+0.3%). Technology path is clear and consumer acceptance is high.
highest_confidence_projections.falsification: Federal automation tax or minimum employment mandates. Consumer backlash against cashierless (unlikely given 87% adoption).

lowest_confidence_projections.reasoning: Counter-signals are strong: 1.1M postings, new categories growing 100%+, METR methodology limits. Aggregate decline may mask barbell transformation.
lowest_confidence_projections.needed_data: 2024-2025 QCEW data for NAICS 5415 to determine actual employment trajectory. Gartner/IDC IT spending forecasts by sub-category.

lowest_confidence_projections.projection: FS cascade creates acute banking stress in 2026-2027
lowest_confidence_projections.reasoning: Banks passed $550B stress tests. Office absorption positive. Vacancy declining. Extended workout more likely than acute cascade.
lowest_confidence_projections.needed_data: Q2-Q3 2026 bank earnings (actual CRE losses vs stress test assumptions). Monthly CMBS delinquency data from Trepp.

lowest_confidence_projections.reasoning: 67% decline is dramatic but could be partially cyclical (hiring freeze, not structural elimination). Need 2-3 more years of data.
lowest_confidence_projections.needed_data: 2026-2027 entry-level hiring data. If junior hiring rebounds with improved economy, pattern is cyclical.

critical_data_points_to_watch.impact: Confirms or falsifies P-040 cross-sector. If Accounting wages below employment growth, Inverse Baumol is cross-sector.
Determines FS cascade timeline (acute vs slow burn). Watch actual CRE loss provisions.
If non-healthcare sectors sustain positive job creation 3+ months, monoculture thesis weakens.
Updates India geographic profile. $100B+ could confirm third compute node thesis.
If rate peaks and begins declining, cascade thesis weakens significantly.
If Engram memory delivers, recalculate all F1 force alignment scores.
Binary event for IT services labor supply.

self_optimization_directive.description: What v3-9 should focus on based on what v3-8 learned

meta_lessons.detail: v3-8 produced the first counter-signals ever. They revealed that our FS cascade timeline may be too aggressive and our IT Services decline may conflate transformation with elimination. Every future cycle MUST produce counter-signals. They are the intellectual integrity mechanism.
meta_lessons.action_for_v39: Produce counter-signals for top 3 projections every cycle. Make it a required Phase 1 output, not optional.

meta_lessons.lesson: Employment projections need uncertainty ranges, not point estimates
meta_lessons.detail: v3-8 counter-signals forced us to widen ranges dramatically (IT Services from 27% decline to 6-27%). Point estimates create false precision. The framework should express projections as probability distributions.
meta_lessons.action_for_v39: Adopt range-based projections for all employment numbers. Express as {low, base, high} scenarios with probability weights.

meta_lessons.lesson: The biggest models aren't in the sectors you expect
meta_lessons.detail: Retail Media Network Platform (86.5) — a business model that straddles retail and advertising — is now #1 overall, outscoring every defense, governance, and infrastructure model. The emergent categories (Layer 4) are producing the highest-scoring models. The framework should pay more attention to cross-sector and emergent models.
meta_lessons.action_for_v39: Dedicate a scan specifically to emergent cross-sector categories. Run a 'category gap' analysis to find economic activities without NAICS codes.

meta_lessons.lesson: Fear friction timing formula shows predictive power
meta_lessons.detail: P-040 test showed flip_delay ≈ fear_friction_score / 20. Securities (15) flipped ~2022, Accounting (35) converging ~2025-2026, Legal (82) predicted ~2027-2028. If this formula holds, it's the most actionable finding in the engine — it converts a qualitative concept (fear) into a quantitative timing prediction.
meta_lessons.action_for_v39: Test fear friction timing formula against 2024 QCEW data when available. If it predicts Accounting flip accurately, formalize as scoring input.

meta_lessons.lesson: Coasean shrinkage is a leading indicator for Inverse Baumol
meta_lessons.detail: Accounting shows establishment growth (+5%) exceeding employment growth (+3%) — more firms forming than workers being hired. This precedes the Inverse Baumol flip by 1-2 years. Test this as a leading indicator across all sectors.
meta_lessons.action_for_v39: Run Coasean shrinkage test (establishment growth > employment growth by >2pp) across all deep-dived sectors to identify next Inverse Baumol candidates.

v39_priority_targets: Transportation & Warehousing deep dive (48-49) — natural extension of Retail deep dive, autonomous vehicles + drone delivery + AI logistics
2024 QCEW data integration when released (~Q3 2026) — critical for P-040 confirmation
Arts/Entertainment deep dive (71) — deepfake/synthetic content + streaming economics + live experience premium
FS cascade timeline recalibration with counter-signal integration
Entry-level extinction permanence test — 2026 hiring data will begin to show if this is cyclical or structural

counter_signals.note: First counter-signals ever produced by the engine
